title.narrative: SOCIAL POLICY OP 3 - INCLUSIVE SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Government has increased capacity to provide inclusive and integrated social protection services, including shock-responsive social protection and strengthened social security for children, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children, adolescents, and women, especially the poorest and most vulnerable, benefit from increasingly inclusive, gender- transformative and child-sensitive social policies at the national and sub-national levels

participating-org.narrative: FONDS D INTERVENTION POUR LE DEVELOPPEMENT

Strengthening integrated administrative systems (such as beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, payments)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government has increased capacity to provide inclusive and integrated social protection services, including shock-responsivesocial protection and strengthened social security for children

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF continued to support the implementation of the national social protection programme in five regions. 350,000 families and 1,050,000 children benefitted from social protection programmes, of which 18,000 families and 82,400 children through UNICEF financing, including 6,100 children living with disability. In addition, UNICEF provided humanitarian cash transfers to 22,500 children (7,500 households) in the south and continued to assure the coordination of the Cash Working Group. UNICEF undertook analytical work to increase the child, gender and disability sensitivity of the national safety net programme, while completing the impact evaluation Let Us Learn (LUL). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
